TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . Before DATE she was a resident of PERSON , GPE , which she left for PERSON . She currently resides in GPE .

CARDINAL . The submissions of the parties with regard to the facts concerning the circumstances of the events of DATE and the ensuing investigation are set out in Part A below . A description of the documents submitted to the ORG is contained in Part B.

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant produced a detailed account of the attack on her . She submitted that prior to DATE she and her family lived at LOC in the Katayama settlement in LOC in PERSON . The applicant has a daughter who was born in DATE . They lived in GPE until DATE and then moved to her parents ' flat in PERSON . In DATE the applicant removed her daughter from GPE after the school which she attended came under attack .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE hostilities resumed in GPE between the NORP forces and the NORP fighters . PERSON and its suburbs came under heavy bombardment . LOC , situated in the northern and central parts of the town , was bombarded from the air and by artillery . The applicant submitted that most residents of the district left for safer areas . The applicant , who stayed because of her poor health , spent DATE hiding from bombardments in the cellars , along with the few other remaining residents of the district . Following heavy fighting , as of DATE the NORP forces started to regain control over the city from the north , and by DATE the central parts of the city were finally taken .

CARDINAL . On DATE a massive attack by the federal forces on their district began . The applicant and CARDINAL other persons were hiding in a garage located in FAC and when the shelling intensified they ran to a nearby cellar . While running , the applicant was wounded in her leg . When the shelling subsided , several military servicemen appeared and ordered everyone out of the cellar . The applicant and others walked out , with their hands on their heads . The soldiers told them that they had an order to kill everyone and that those who remained in the city had assisted the fighters ( “ boyeviki ” ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that the soldiers had not listened to their explanations and refused to look at their identity documents . They had ordered the inhabitants to return to the cellar and , once the residents went downstairs , threw tear - gas grenades into it . The people in the cellar wept and asked them to stop , and finally the soldiers ordered them to come out again , CARDINAL by CARDINAL . The applicant , who was wounded , could not walk by herself and was assisted by a NORP man . CARDINAL NORP women and another NORP man walked out first and were shot at the entrance to the garage by machine - gun fire . The soldiers then shot at the third woman and at the applicant and her helper , whose body eventually covered hers .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant lost consciousness and , when she awoke , she realised that the others were dead . She was wounded in the chest and was bleeding from the mouth . When TIME fell , the applicant walked over to a neighbouring street where the PERSON family lived ( see ORG and GPE v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL and QUANTITY , DATE ) . They gave her first aid and allowed her to stay in their shed . They said that they were expecting a second check [ by security forces ] and were afraid to let her into the house .

CARDINAL . The applicant , who was bleeding and afraid to remain in ORG , changed clothes and walked to the roadblock with a white flag . There the soldiers checked her documents and let her through . The applicant did not tell them about the attack on her . On TIME the applicant was taken to ORG by ORG ( the applicant in the case of GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) who had been looking for her relatives in LOC ( they were later found killed ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant remained in the PERSON village ( ORG district ) hospital until DATE . There she was diagnosed with gunshot and shrapnel wounds to the knee joints and chest , concussion and neurotic asthenia . She was treated and her wounds were operated on . She submitted the relevant medical documents .
CARDINAL . While in the hospital the applicant was interviewed by human - rights activists , who later reported her story . It was also related in several publications .

CARDINAL . After being discharged from hospital , the applicant stayed in ORG , in the premises of an old pig farm used by other refugees from GPE . In DATE the applicant went to PERSON to find out about the state of her flat and property . Her neighbours told her that unknown persons had been looking for her .

CARDINAL . The applicant did not seek any direct contacts with law - enforcement bodies in the aftermath of the attack . Nevertheless the events in LOC , including the attack on the applicant , became known to the authorities shortly afterwards due to NGO and media reports .

CARDINAL . Several human - rights NGOs contacted the law - enforcement authorities in relation to the events in LOC of ORG in DATE , when CARDINAL local residents were allegedly executed by unidentified detachments of the NORP military .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG issued a report entitled “ Civilian Killings in LOC of NORP ” in which it accused the NORP forces of deliberately murdering CARDINAL civilians DATE and DATE . ORG interviewed survivors , eyewitnesses and relatives of the dead . The report contains information about the attack on the applicant and the killing of CARDINAL people in a cellar , based on an interview with her .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG contacted the NORP authorities , including the President , ORG and the Minister of Defence with a request to investigate credible allegations of the murder of CARDINAL civilians in LOC , with reference to the applicant 's case .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the publication of an article entitled “ Freedom or Death ” in the ORG newspaper on DATE , the investigator of ORG opened a criminal investigation under LAW ( a ) , ( d ) , ( e ) and ( j ) of LAW “ concerning mass murder by the ' CARDINALth brigade ' of the civilian population in the GPE Katayama settlement of Grozny on DATE ” . Within the scope of that investigation , on DATE PERSON submitted a statement to ORG about the murder of her brother PERSON , whose bullet - ridden body had been found on DATE in the courtyard of his house in LOC of PERSON . In her letter she submitted that on DATE she had seen CARDINAL bodies ( QUANTITY women and QUANTITY men ) in a garage at FAC . She gave the applicant 's full name , referred to her as a witness of the killings committed on DATE and stated that she had talked to her in the hospital in GPE ( see ORG and GPE v. GPE , cited above , § § DATE ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG issued a document entitled “ Memorandum on Domestic Prosecutions for Violations of International Human Rights and Humanitarian Law in GPE ” , in which it reported a lack of progress in the investigation into the attack on the applicant and into other killings committed in LOC at the same time .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that certain persons were looking for her and wanted to punish her for relating her story . She submitted that , DATE , her father in GPE , a friend in PERSON , her former boyfriend and her sister in the PERSON region had been contacted by persons asking about her whereabouts . Her former boyfriend had been beaten and told to “ keep away ” from her . The applicant , who still suffered from the consequences of her wounds , was afraid of approaching the authorities for fear that her whereabouts might become known to her persecutors . She submitted that in DATE she had received medical treatment in GPE for neurological problems resulting from the attack .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the applicant had failed to apply to the authorities with a complaint , as a result of which the circumstances of the attack had become known to them only after the communication of the present application . On DATE ORG initiated criminal investigation file no . DATE under LAW ( infliction of serious injuries ) . The investigation confirmed the attack on the applicant . It also confirmed that the applicant had spent time in hospital in GPE suffering from gunshot wounds . CARDINAL witnesses were questioned . However , the investigation could not question the applicant because she did not make her whereabouts known to the authorities . In DATE the Government forwarded to the ORG a request by ORG seeking assistance in finding the applicant , and a copy of the decision to grant her victim status in the proceedings of criminal investigation no . DATE , to be countersigned by her .

CARDINAL . In DATE the investigation concerning the attack upon the applicant was joined with another investigation , pending since DATE , concerning the discovery of CARDINAL bodies with gunshot wounds at FAC . The investigation had been adjourned and reopened , and was on - going . It failed to locate and question the applicant or to identify the culprits .
CARDINAL . Following the ORG 's requests , the ORG submitted documents from the criminal investigation file opened in relation to the attack on the applicant ( see Part B below ) .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted CARDINAL pages of documents from the investigation file in criminal case no . DATE . The most important documents submitted by the ORG can be summarised as follows :

CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy Chechnya Prosecutor decided to open criminal investigation into the infliction of serious injuries on the applicant , following receipt of the appropriate information from ORG . The case file was assigned no . DATE and the investigation was entrusted to the investigative department of ORG of the ORG ( FAC управление при МВД ЧР ) .
CARDINAL . The investigation made several unsuccessful attempts to locate and question the applicant through ORG entities in GPE , PERSON and in the PERSON region .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the housing bureau of the LOC informed the local department of the interior ( ROVD ) that house no . CARDINAL at FAC was unsuitable for habitation and that the applicant was not listed among the residents .

CARDINAL . In DATE the investigation questioned a friend of the applicant in PERSON . The woman stated that she had collected the applicant from the ORG hospital in DATE and that the latter had stayed in her house for DATE . She confirmed that the applicant had told her that she had been shot by armed men during a “ mopping - up ” operation in PERSON and that CARDINAL or QUANTITY people had been killed during the same attack . The witness was not aware of the applicant 's whereabouts .

CARDINAL . In DATE the investigation questioned PERSON . , the applicant 's sister who lived in the PERSON region and at whose address the applicant had a formal registration . The witness stated that the applicant had stayed with her in DATE , after which she had left and the witness was not aware of her whereabouts . The applicant had told her that she had been wounded during a “ mopping - up ” operation in Grozny in DATE , when armed men had killed several people in the cellar . The witness stated that her sister continued to suffer from the consequences of the attack , that she could not talk about the incident and that remembering it provoked serious nervous distress .

CARDINAL . In DATE the investigation requested the criminal police of GPE to assist in finding the applicant and to investigate her complaint about harassment by unknown persons in retribution for her complaint . Similar requests were forwarded to the ORG regional investigation department and to LOC .
CARDINAL . In DATE the NORP district hospital in GPE informed the investigation that the applicant had been treated there DATE and DATE for gunshot wounds to the knees and chest .

CARDINAL . The investigation then questioned medical personnel from the hospital 's accident ward . They confirmed that in DATE the applicant had been treated there . The applicant 's medical record had been destroyed during a fire in the hospital , except for a registration log containing basic information about the applicant 's stay .

CARDINAL . In DATE the investigation questioned PERSON , whose brother PERSON had been killed during the same attack in which the applicant had been wounded . The witness stated that around DATE she had visited the applicant in hospital and had learnt from her that her brother had been killed in the cellar of a garage in CARDINALth FAC by armed men in camouflaged uniforms . The witness and her CARDINAL sisters had travelled to PERSON and found CARDINAL or CARDINAL bodies with gunshot wounds in the cellar of house no . CARDINAL in CARDINALth FAC . The witness and her sisters removed the body of their brother PERSON , which bore numerous gunshot wounds , and took it to the FAC district for burial . No additional questions were put to the witness at that time about the other details of her brother 's death , nor was she asked if an investigation had been mounted .

CARDINAL . Several local residents questioned by the investigators in DATE stated that in DATE they had been outside ORG and that they were not aware of the circumstances of the attack on the applicant or of her whereabouts . They were aware , however , mostly by hearsay , of the murders of residents who had remained in PERSON , committed in DATE by unknown men in military uniforms . Several witnesses stated that they were aware that the murders had been committed during a “ mopping - up ” operation . In particular , several witnesses were aware of the killing of the PERSON family , of ORG and of ORG ( see PERSON and GPE v. GPE mentioned above ) .
CARDINAL . PERSON . testified that he was aware of the killing of QUANTITY persons and the wounding of a woman named PERSON in the garage of house no . CARDINAL at the CARDINALth FAC .

CARDINAL . In DATE the investigation questioned PERSON ( the applicant in the case of GPE v. GPE , no . MONEY ) , whose mother and brother had been found killed in LOC in DATE . She stated that she was aware of the attack on the applicant , but had no information about the exact circumstances of the attack or of the applicant 's whereabouts .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator from the Staropromyslovskiy ROVD examined the courtyard and the buildings located at no . CARDINAL in CARDINALth FAC . They found the house and the garage destroyed and uninhabited . Nothing of interest to the investigation was noted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was granted victim status in the proceedings . As the applicant 's whereabouts were not established , she did not countersign the document .

CARDINAL . In DATE an officer of LOC in charge of collecting information on the applicant 's case reported to the head of the ROVD that , as a result of questioning of the local residents , it could be presumed that “ the crime could have been committed by military servicemen , possibly of Ossetian ethnic background , possibly enrolled on a contractual basis . Numbers of military units , vehicles and armoured vehicles could not be established ” .

CARDINAL . In DATE the Staropromyslovskiy ROVD informed the investigator in charge of the case that they were unable to identify the army units which had conducted the special operations in the district .

CARDINAL . The investigation requested several agencies of ORG and of ORG to provide them with information about the location and activities of their units in DATE in the PERSON settlement of LOC . In response they were informed that such information was unavailable because the currently functioning structures had been established after DATE and had no information relevant to the preceding periods .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened a criminal investigation with regard to the discovery of CARDINAL bodies in CARDINALth FAC .

CARDINAL . In DATE LOC wrote to the local ROVD and informed it that their office was investigating criminal case no . DATE , related to the discovery of CARDINAL bodies at “ house no . CARDINAL in CARDINALth FAC ” . The letter alleged that the information received from ORG indicated that the applicant had been a witness to the murder of CARDINAL people at “ house no . CARDINAL in GPE ” . It further stated that the applicant had never applied to the authorities with information about the incident and instructed the ROVD to carry out a verification of the facts , including locating and questioning the applicant and examination of the site as indicated by her .

CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings in the CARDINAL criminal cases were joined , as they concerned the same incident . The new case file was assigned no . DATE and ORG was charged with the investigation .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings several orders were issued by the supervising prosecutors enumerating the steps to be taken by the investigators . In particular , in DATE a prosecutor from ORG ordered that additional information be obtained from the local authorities and from the military prosecutor of ORG ( UGA ) , and that to other possible witnesses to the crimes , including the applicant , be identified and questioned .
